definition: lit. heart alarmed, body leaping (idiom); fear and trepidation in the face of disaster
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]
to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm
meat/flesh/pulp (of a fruit)/(coll.) (of a fruit) squashy/(of a person) flabby/irresolute/Kangxi radical 130
to jump/to hop/to skip over/to bounce/to palpitate

sentences.english: But even that makes insecure Pakistanis jumpy.
sentences.chinese: 但是即使那樣也使感覺不安全的巴基斯坦人心驚肉跳。

sentences.english: The old lady knew that something was going to happen, and she was very jumpy .
sentences.chinese: 這老太太知道要出事了，於是嚇得心驚肉跳。

sentences.english: She was jumpy during her job interview because she was so nervous.
sentences.chinese: 她在應徵面談的時候心驚肉跳，因爲她太緊張了。

sentences.english: The hooting of an owl broke the silence now and again, giving Linda the creeps.
sentences.chinese: 貓頭鷹的叫聲不時打破寂靜，使琳達心驚肉跳。

sentences.english: Even later, the clock in the parlour chimes twelve heartbeats.
sentences.chinese: 再後來，客廳的鐘心驚肉跳地敲打了十二下。

sentences.english: I get the willies just standing here.
sentences.chinese: 光站在這裏我就心驚肉跳的了。

sentences.english: The dark, dank cave gave me the willies.
sentences.chinese: 這陰暗潮溼的山洞使我感到心驚肉跳。

sentences.english: The murder scene in the film horrified me .
sentences.chinese: 電影中的暗殺場面使我心驚肉跳。

sentences.english: A New Thinking of War and Peace;
sentences.chinese: 想到未來的核子戰爭，人人心驚肉跳。

sentences.english: His heart quaked with panic at the news.
sentences.chinese: 這個消息令他心驚肉跳。

sentences.english: A person walking on it dare not look sideways, and a gust of wind would make him tremble with fear.
sentences.chinese: 人走在上面不敢斜視，山風襲來，更讓人心驚肉跳。

sentences.english: You keep looking at the clock and are alarmed at time passing.
sentences.chinese: 你不停地看錶心驚肉跳的看每一秒過去。

definition: to tremble with fear (idiom)/scared witless
to laugh involuntarily/Taiwan pr. [e4 ran2 shi1 xiao4]
stupefied/flabbergasted
lit. dumb as a wooden chicken (idiom); fig. dumbstruck
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
the content of a conversation/words/remarks
lit. crow and peacock make no sound/absolute silence (idiom); not a single voice can be heard/absolute silence
to shiver
to turn pale with fright (idiom)
to rant and rave/to be scared, upset (Beijing dialect)
to die (idiom)/to breathe one's last/to give up the ghost
to be alarmed/to be terrified
to be at a loss for words/speechless
overwhelmed with shock, horror or amazement/dumbstruck/aghast
lit. draw legs on a snake (idiom); fig. to ruin the effect by adding sth superfluous/to overdo it

Feast at Hongmen/(fig.) banquet set up with the aim of murdering a guest/refers to a famous episode in 206 BC when future Han emperor Liu Bang 劉邦|刘邦[Liu2 Bang1] escaped attempted murder by his rival Xiang Yu 項羽|项羽[Xiang4 Yu3]
